i started playing because of the reviews.
5 minutes into the game and all the bad guys want me dead, i have no idea why though i keep running.
2 hours in, and i have only little more idea as to why and where i'm going to though at this point i'm speeding in my cool hoverboat and having a great time. the game keeps getting better and never gets tiring.
the graphics are surprisingly passable for a game made so long ago and all other aspects (ai, physics, weapons) are great.
i had great time playing this, highly recommended

Excellent game, and still holds up after 16 years. Visuals are great, sound design is excellent, and the game is super smooth as expected with the source engine. Menu UI doesn't scale well, but in-game HUD scaled perfectly in 4k.

Half-Life 2 :>

This game Is wonderful, I enjoyed so much about this game heres a list of 5 things I liked about the game.
*Scenery the maps look really good and the enviromental story telling.
*Gameplay the puzzles in this game can get you confused and get your last braincells.
*Combat (yes i know this is gameplay) the combat is pretty good with some minor issues here and there but other wise it feels very fleshed out.
*Music the soundtrack is good with some pretty groovy beats here and there.
*Optimization this game was optimized well with each area being loaded in apart instead of chapters being one whole area which is why the loading screens exist not just in between chapters.

loved this game. 10/10

Half-Life 2... wow. This is how you learn from mistakes and improve upon them. Valve clearly made the right decisions with the 'new' Source engine compared to the GoldSrc engine the original Half-Life. Graphics are great and Gameplay is "Out of this world".
Graphics - while a little aged - are great. each character feels like a person and the engine does a great job of conveying emotion, with assistance of the brilliant VO provided by the actors. Physics provided by the engine is incredible, and really allows for amazing gameplay options, but can sometimes be a little buggy.
Gameplay is nice and smooth, with the physics of the gravity gun offering a new variable to combat, a truly creative and amazing way to improve the game. While the diversity of weapons has decreased since the original Half-Life, weapons are better, as they 'feel' like they actually have weight and knockback, unlike in the original.
Overall, this game is truly amazing, deserving of all the praise it receives, and a great improvement over the original game.
Half-Life 2 gets an 8/10.

This game is an asbsolute masterpiece of game design, and truly one of the defining FPS games. In my opinion, it's the greatest action-adventure game of all time, and although the level design is linear to a certain extent, it's so open it doesn't feel that way at all. It's a large and epic story, almost a road trip kind of story. And it proves Gordon Freeman is one of the greatest protagonists of all time, and he never even makes a grunt the entire series. 
Valve's best game in my opinion, although Portal and Left 4 Dead 1 & 2 are close contenders. I'd give it a 9.5/10, and an A+ if I graded them that way lol. 
Play this game as soon as you can.
